issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares addGuestStudents(int) with a void return type, but the solution implementation returns a boolean (public boolean addGuestStudents(int)). The template leaves a TODO and does not provide a signature, so a student following the UML would implement a void method while the reference solution (and possibly hidden tests) uses a boolean return. This mismatch can confuse students about the intended API and lead to failing tests or incorrect implementations.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the API consistent across artifacts. Either (A) change the UML and problem text to specify addGuestStudents(int): boolean and document what the boolean indicates (e.g., success/failure), or (B) change the solution method to have a void return type (void addGuestStudents(int)) so it matches the UML. Also update the template to include the chosen signature to guide students. Ensure any tests are adjusted to expect the chosen return type.
